title: (x) Come and visit, stay for tea - custom font {Jean Y (self)}
content: ID this font and win a lot of people's eternal gratitude...it has everyone at a.b.f. and annexcafe.fonts totally stumped. You are my last resource. Can you ID it? ![Mystery font-18k](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124524im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32647.jpg)
author: jeanne11

comments.content:
Since the OP didn't come back yet, I will post the reply she received from the publisher. She sent it to me as a follow up for her request for an ID also:   
   
_"Thank you for contacting Ronnie Sellers Productions.   
   
In regards to your question about the font in the Power of Women   
calendar, you'll be interested to know that it is the artist's own font.   
Unfortunately, I do not have permission to give you this font. If you   
are interested in more information, visit Jane Evershed's web site at   
 [http://www.janeevershed.com/new/home.htm/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124524/http:/www.janeevershed.com/new/home.htm/).   
   
Kind regards,   
Customer Service "_   
      
   
[Note: I told her it was a font I didn't recognize, and then I saw her post here. When I saw she didn't post the same information I thought maybe I could close it out for her by this method.]

Thanks, Mike...sorry I didn't follow up right away. I thought maybe someone else here might come up with some more "close" suggestions. BTW, Tempus Sans isn't too bad. Appreciate your help....   
   
 ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124524im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) Jeanne
